events.name: Progressing further through the lithium supply chain
events.wd_label: Progressing further through the lithium supply chain
events.wd_description: Following the conversion to intermediate products, various manufacturing and end-use applications are explored.

events.name: Manufacturing of lithium-ion batteries
events.wd_description: Actual manufacturing occurs primarily in China, Japan, and South Korea.
events.description: Actual manufacturing occurs primarily in China, Japan, and South Korea.

events.name: U.S. government plans to use the Defense Production Act
events.wd_label: U.S. government plans to use the Defense Production Act
events.wd_description: To boost domestic production of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles.

events.name: Exploring alternative sources of lithium
events.wd_description: Due to concerns about the sustainability of current supply chains.
events.description: Due to concerns about the sustainability of current supply chains.

events.name: Researching more efficient extraction methods for lithium
events.wd_label: Researching more efficient extraction methods for lithium
events.wd_description: To reduce environmental impact and increase production capacity.
events.description: To reduce environmental impact and increase production capacity.

events.name: Domestic supply chain challenges
events.wd_description: Despite funding for feasibility studies, challenges remain in capital expenses for building mining operations and the processing of lithium compounds, which is primarily done in China.
events.description: Despite funding for feasibility studies, challenges remain in capital expenses for building mining operations and the processing of lithium compounds, which is primarily done in China.

events.name: Processing challenges for lithium carbonate and hydroxide
events.description: The significant risks in the lithium supply chain lie in the processing of lithium carbonate and hydroxide, with 60% of this processing occurring in China.

events.name: Capital expense challenges for domestic projects
events.ta1explanation: There is a concern that while feasibility studies are funded, there is no government assistance for the actual capital expenses associated with building mining operations.
events.description: There is a concern that while feasibility studies are funded, there is no government assistance for the actual capital expenses associated with building mining operations.
